[Groovy] Class DateUtil

class DateUtil

DateUtil groovy class provides generic methods for java.util.Calendar

Shashank Agrawal

formatDate

static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date, java.lang.String timezone, java.lang.String format)
Returns formatted date string with given time zone and format. If time zone not specified date will be parsed with defaul time zone.
Parameters:
date - Date to be parsed.
timezone - Sting value containing time zone.
format - Format in which date is being parsed. Default set to ["MM/dd/yyyy"].
Returns:
Parsed string Date with given time zone and format.

Map containing date range.

getDateRange

java.util.Map getDateRange(java.util.Map args, boolean rangeFromNow = true)
A generic method to get date range according to given arguments
Parameters:
REQUIRED - args
rangeFromNow - set this to false if do not wants date range from current date, else startDate will be current date. args.from* parameters will only be valid if this is set to false.
args.fromNumberOfDays - the number of days before from today.
args.fromDay - the day from which date range needs to be calculated.
REQUIRED - args.toNumberOfDays the number of days from today.
Returns:

getDateRangeForComingWeekend

java.lang.Object getDateRangeForComingWeekend()
Returns current week date range for [Saturday - Sunday] . i.e. Saturday and Sunday of current week.
Returns:
Map containing Saturday and Sunday of current week.

getDateRangeForThisMonth

java.lang.Object getDateRangeForThisMonth()
Returns current month date range i.e. Start day and Last day of current month.
Returns:
Map containing Start day and Last day of current month.

getDateRangeForThisWeek

java.util.Map getDateRangeForThisWeek(boolean includeWeekend = true)
Returns current week date range i.e. Start date and End Date of week.
Parameters:
includeWeekend - Boolean value used to specify whether to include weekend or not.
Returns:
Map containing Start date and End Date of current week.
